definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Then the rate hike on second-hand housing market in our province the true impact of what?
sentences.chinese: 那么，加息对二手房市场在我们省的真正影响是什么？

sentences.english: Their issuance is meant to limit lending in the same way an interest-rate increase might do.
sentences.chinese: 政府希望以此在抑制贷款方面产生与加息相同的效果。

sentences.english: The state-run China Securities Journal was more cautious, saying a rate hike is likely this month [zh].
sentences.chinese: 《中国证券报》则更为谨慎，说本月可能会加息。

sentences.english: Stern dissented three times in favor of raising rates in 1996.
Asian stocks stumbled briefly when China raised its interest rates.
sentences.chinese: 当中国加息时，亚洲股市曾短暂回调。

sentences.english: Such increases are pouring cold water on many once-hot markets.
sentences.chinese: 这些加息给一度火热的市场泼了一盆冷水。

sentences.english: That view effectively quashed market speculation of a near-term ECB rate hike and sent the Euro reeling.
sentences.chinese: 这样的观点有效打消了有关央行近期加息的猜测。

sentences.english: Li's attitude is the first time outside official "rate hike Cantata" response.
sentences.chinese: 李的态度是首次境外官方的“加息大合唱”的回应。

sentences.english: Several analysts had expected the RBA to commence rate hikes a few months later.
sentences.chinese: 一些分析师曾预计澳大利亚央行几个月后开始加息。

sentences.english: Arledge expects the first rate increase to come during the second quarter of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 阿利奇预计首次加息将发生在2011年第二季度。

sentences.english: Now, almost all of those nations have stopped raising rates.
sentences.chinese: 如今，几乎所有这些国家都停止了加息。

sentences.english: But he did not indicate a predisposition to raise interest rates soon.
sentences.chinese: 但他没有表示出将很快加息的倾向。

sentences.english: Central banks in these economies aren't going to rush to raise their benchmark interest rates anytime soon, for fear of stalling any recovery.
sentences.chinese: 这些国家的央行为了不阻止经济复苏，不会冒然加息。

definition: US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
dove faction (opposite: 鹰派, hawks)/peace party/the faction seeking peace
abbr. for various central banks, notably 中國人民銀行|中国人民银行[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Yin2 hang2] and 中央銀行|中央银行[Zhong1 yang1 Yin2 hang2]
hawk faction (opposite: 鸽派, doves)/fierce and combative party/war party/warmongers
